trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of nutrition care and functional progressive resistance exercises on strength and improved mobility in older adults living in residential aged care.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects of nutrition care and functional progressive resistance exercises on mobility in older adults living in residential aged care.

interventions.interventions: Participants will be randomly allocated to one of two groups. All participants will receive usual care, however, one group will additionally receive strengthening exercises for the lower limbs together with nutrition care. These exercise sessions will last no longer than 45 minutes two times per week for 12 weeks. We will measure leg strength in the physiotherapy gymnasium before and after the 12 weeks of exercises and then one month after the exercises have finished to see if the effects are retained. Participants will also be interviewed by the Dietitian pre and post treatment and at a 4 week follow up to determine their nutrition risks, status, nutrition goals and nutrition care plan. There will be weekly follow up by the Dietitian and Nutrition Technician to check the effectiveness of the plan and achievement of goals.
interventions.comparator: All participants will receive usual care, the control group will receive traditional general exercises together with nutrition care.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured within 1 week before and 1 week after the 12 weeks of therapy as well as at a 4 week follow up after therapy has finished

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured within 1 week before and 1 week after the 12 weeks of therapy as well as at a 4 week follow up after therapy has finished.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: To be included in the trial subjects will require written approval of their treating doctor, and will be further screened by the Physiotherapist that is working at the hostel who is independent and is not involved with the project. Inclusion criteria will thus include: approval of treating doctor, Mini Mental State Examination >23, resident of Kingston site residential aged care facility
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unstable acute or chronic medical condition, musculoskeletal or neurological conditions that will preclude the subject from participating in a 12 week exercise program, terminal illness or receiving chemotherapy, unable to walk 6 metres.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation will be concealed using sealed opaque envelopes
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomisation table from a statistic book. Block randomisation will be employed in the study, with bocks of 14 and no stratification

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This pilot study aims to compare the effect of (1) a nutrition care program and functional strength training with (2) a nutrition care program with conventional exercises in frail older people. Blinded testers will measure performance changes over time.
